description: Representative Dan Goldman (D-NY) states President Trump is gaslighting Americans & betraying his campaign promises by calling affordability a Democratic con job. Goldman also discusses his new bill that would add a new tax to the wealthiest Americans and talks about why he gives President Trump's economy a F rating. He speaks with Joe Mathieu on the late edition of Bloomberg's "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Can't Lie to People's Wallets: Rep. Goldman on Trump

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump said he will be looking at a couple candidates to chair the Federal Reserve, after the Financial Times reported that he would begin interviews with contenders this week.
title: Trump Says He Has ‘Good Idea’ of Who He Wants for Fed Chair

author: Olga Kharif
description: President Donald Trump’s branded coin, down 87% since its launch, will be used in a ‘Billionaires Club’-themed game in the latest publicity effort by its promoter to revive the languishing token.
title: Trump Ally Plots Gamified Bid to Boost Memecoin After 87% Crash

author: Maya Averbuch
description: Read the story in English
title: Hondureños mantienen la calma pese a un prolongado y caótico recuento de votos

author: Monte Reel, Mark Chediak
description: The once unlikely alliance took root in Texas and now reaches right into the White House, where President Trump wants to ban wind energy projects.
title: Nuclear and Fossil Fuels Join Forces to Undermine Renewables

author: K Oanh Ha, Yang Yang, Naomi Ng
description: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast: India wants to dethrone China as the world’s top toymaker. But the gambit faces hurdles.
title: How Tariff Chaos Threw India's Toy-Making Dreams Into Disarray

author: Brian Platt, Josh Wingrove, Layan Odeh
description: Canada’s ambassador to Washington is preparing to leave office, and Prime Minister Mark Carney is considering a former BlackRock Inc. senior executive for the job ahead of crucial trade talks with the US and Mexico.
title: Canada’s US Envoy to Step Down; Mark Wiseman Seen as Likely Successor

author: Jarrell Dillard
description: While job openings picked up last month, so did layoffs
title: Trump Promotes Economy Amid Signs of a Job Market Slowdown

author: Alastair Gale
description: Japan still lags behind the US and Europe in defending against cyber threats and improvements are needed across the corporate sector, the nation’s new cyber chief said.
title: Japan’s Cyber Chief Warns Nation Still Behind on Cybersecurity

author: Jen Judson, Anthony Capaccio
description: The US Navy is turning to Palantir Technologies Inc. as part of its years-long effort to speed up submarine production, in a bet that the company’s analytics capabilities can better expose supply-chain problems.
title: US Navy Turns to Palantir as Part of Push to Speed Shipbuilding

description: On today's episode of Bloomberg Businessweek Daily, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec count down to Wednesday's Federal Reserve decision, with markets on hold as traders await a likely rate cut. Bloomberg's Stuart Paul and Michael MacKenzie join the show to discuss. Also on today's show, Bloomberg's Hannah Miller and Sally Bakewell on the ongoing fight between Netflix and Paramount Skydance over Warner Bros. Discovery, and Morgan Stanley Real Estate Investing Co-CEO Lauren Hochfelder examines the 2026 outlook for the US real estate market. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Wall Street On Hold Ahead of Wednesday Fed Meeting | Bloomberg Businessweek Daily 12/9/2025

author: Josh Sisco
description: The US Justice Department is weighing a challenge to a deal between two of the largest companies offering software to small, independent pharmacies, as antitrust enforcers step up their focus on the health-care industry.
title: DOJ Weighs Antitrust Challenge of Pharmacy Software Merger

description: Morgan Stanley Real Estate Investing Co-CEO Lauren Hochfelder believes that we are at an 'inflection point' for real estate heading into 2026, indicating that sellers are more motivated, buyers more interested, and debt markets are 'wide open,' which could help lead a transition into a recovery period. She joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to examine the state of the US real estate market.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Real Estate at 'Inflection Point,' Says Morgan Stanley's Hochfelder

description: Bloomberg's Stuart Paul and Michael Mackenzie preview the Fed's decision Wednesday, as critical economic data for the FOMC remains delayed by the recent government shutdown and recent indicators point to differing targets between inflation and the labor market.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Fed Expected to Cut as Slow Eco Data Shows Conflicting Goals

author: Edward Ludlow, Maggie Eastland
description: President Donald Trump decided to let Nvidia Corp. sell its H200 artificial intelligence chips to China after concluding the move carried a lower security risk because the company’s Chinese archrival, Huawei Technologies Co., already offers AI systems with comparable performance, according to a person familiar with the deliberations.
title: Trump’s Reprieve for Nvidia’s H200 Spurred by Huawei’s AI Gains

author: Maya Averbuch
description: The last time a presidential election was running this close in Honduras, the streets of its capital erupted in deadly violence.
title: Hondurans Heed Calls for Calm as Chaotic Vote Count Drags On

description: KindlyMD Chairman & CEO David Bailey is the man credited with converting President Donald Trump into a crypto believer. He discusses the slump in DATs, possible consolidation of the companies, a potential bitcoin reserve and crypto's influence in the upcoming US midterms on 'Bloomberg Crypto.' (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Slump of DATs, Crypto's Influence on Trump: David Bailey

description: On the early edition of Balance of Power, Bloomberg Washington Correspondent Joe Mathieu discusses President Donald Trump's trip to Pennsylvania Tuesday evening. On today's show, Slovenia Deputy Prime Minister Tanja Fajon, Stonecourt Capital Partner Rick Davis, Harvard Kennedy School's Ash Center Visiting Democracy Fellow Jeanne Sheehan Zaino and Republican Senator Pete Ricketts of Nebraska. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Senate GOP Floats Health Plan | Balance of Power: Early Edition 12/9/2025

description: Republican Senator from Nebraska Pete Ricketts says that republicans are putting forward a plan to 'fix Obamacare' that doesn't include extending ACA subsidies that were intended to 'buck up a system that was failing.' Senator Ricketts also discusses his SAFE act bill to limit high level chip sales to China amid the news that President Trump granted permission for Nvidia to export its H200 chip to China.   (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Republicans Float Health Care Proposal Frameworks

author: Caitlin Reilly, Erik Wasson
description: Senate Republicans plan to vote this week on a likely futile plan to counter Democrats’ push to extend expiring Obamacare subsidies as health care costs for more than 20 million people are set to spike on Jan. 1.
title: Senate GOP Sets Doomed Vote to Replace Expiring Health Subsidies

description: Although Netflix Inc. and Paramount Skydance have wagered competing bids for Warner Bros. Discovery Inc., Paramount's offer includes the struggling cable TV networks, while Netflix's offer does not include these assets. The value of the faltering cable TV networks like CNN, TNT and Discovery — among the TV industry’s least-coveted properties today — is much of what separates Paramount’s hostile takeover bid from Netflix’s friendly offer. Bloomberg's Hannah Miller joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break it all down.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Warner Bros. Fight Hinges on Value of Shrinking Cable Assets

description: Slovenian Minister of Foreign and European Affairs Tanja Fajon said Ukraine and Europe need to be involved in negotiations for a ceasefire with Russia and that any conditions for a peace plan must be acceptable for the Ukrainians. Fajon also pushed back against territorial concessions, saying that no one can change internationally recognized borders 'by force.' She speaks on "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Slovenia Calls for Ukraine to Have Better Seat in Peace Talks

author: Magdalena Del Valle, Joe Mathieu, Jan Bratanic
description: Slovenia’s foreign minister commended the Trump administration for working to broker a deal between Russia and Ukraine but said that the continent’s leaders and Ukraine should get a better seat at the ceasefire negotiations.
title: Slovenia Calls for Ukraine to Have Better Seat in Peace Talks

author: William Horobin
description: France’s National Assembly adopted a social security bill for next year, avoiding a potential government crisis and making it more likely lawmakers will pass a new budget by year-end.
title: French Lawmakers Approve Welfare Bill in Win for Government

author: William Horobin
description: France’s economy is set to expand 0.2% in the fourth quarter, shrugging off uncertainty over whether there’ll be a budget for next year, the central bank said.
title: Bank of France Expects Year-End Growth Despite Budget Doubts

author: Lucy White
description: The UK could face a £10.8 billion ($14.4 billion) hit due to the restrictions on legal immigration proposed by the government earlier this year, according to an impact assessment from the Home Office.
title: UK Faces Risk of £11 Billion Hit From Immigration Restrictions

author: Nojoud Al Mallees
description: The Canadian government is proposing sweeping changes to criminal law in an effort to crack down on gender-based violence and predatory behavior toward children, including requiring social media platforms to report child sexual abuse material to police.
title: Canada to Require Social Media Sites to Report Child Sex Abuse

author: Jimmy Jenkins
description: President Donald Trump’s campaign against expanded rights for transgender people has taken a new turn as the US Justice Department rewrites policies intended to protect vulnerable prison inmates from sexual assault and harassment.
title: Trump Administration Ditches Protections for Transgender Inmates

author: Augusta Saraiva, Andre Loureiro Dias
description: Donald Trump could help Brazil fight organized crime by arresting the Florida resident accused of being the South American country’s biggest tax evader, President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva told his US counterpart.
title: Lula Asked for Trump’s Help to Arrest Brazil’s ‘Largest Debtor’

author: William Horobin
description: France’s National Assembly adopted the spending part of the social security bill in the first of two votes on Tuesday that are crucial to Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu’s attempt to bring fiscal stability to the country.
title: French Lawmakers Back Spending Part of Social-Security Budget

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court weighed Republican calls for a fresh rollback of campaign-finance regulations, questioning federal caps that limit spending by political parties in coordination with candidates.
title: Supreme Court Questions Spending Curbs on Political Parties

author: William Horobin
description: French lawmakers in the Green group at the National Assembly will abstain in a crucial vote on the social security budget, increasing the likelihood Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu can avoid a government crisis.
title: France’s Bid for Welfare Budget Gets Boost as Greens to Abstain

author: Michael Hirtzer
description: Deere & Co. said it is helping US farmers “substantially” cut costs, after President Donald Trump pressured farm-equipment manufacturers to drop prices for tractors.
title: Deere Says It’s Aiding Farmers After Trump Pushes Tractor Makers

author: Manuela Tobias
description: President Javier Milei is preparing to embark on an ambitious push to reform Argentina’s economy when a friendlier Congress takes office Wednesday. Investors hope it’s just the opening act to a much bigger move: dismantling the rigid currency controls that defined his first two years in office.
title: Milei Readies Major Reforms While Markets Await Currency Shift

author: Jen Judson
description: The Defense Department said it has chosen Alphabet Inc.’s Gemini for Government system to deliver artificial intelligence capability for its roughly three million civilian and military employees.
title: Pentagon Picks Google AI Platform for Its Millions of Employees

author: Giovanna Bellotti Azevedo, Vinicius Andrade, Leda Alvim
description: As Brazil’s markets rallied, month after month, and global investors kept flooding in, the gains were big enough to overshadow the risks from a presidential election that’s still almost a year away.
title: Political Shake-Up Hits Hedge-Fund Trade as Brazil Markets Swoon

author: Zoltan Simon
description: Hungary’s opposition leader called on Prime Minister Viktor Orban to resign and call early elections after a video was published showing the physical abuse at a state-run juvenile detention center in Budapest.
title: Hungarian Opposition Demands Orban Resign Over Abuse Scandal

description: Proposals to create a new UK-EU customs union have been supported in the Commons, following a vote by MPs.
title: Proposal to Create New UK-EU Customs Union Supported by MPs

author: Michael J Kavanagh
description: More than 200,000 people have fled renewed fighting in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo in the past week, according to the United Nations, as rebels continue to advance just days after US President Donald Trump declared peace had been reached in the long-running conflict.
title: Congo Conflict Forces 200,000 to Flee Despite Trump Peace Deal

author: David Feliba
description: Argentine authorities raided the offices of the country’s football federation early Tuesday as part of a corruption probe, according to local media, heightening tensions between President Javier Milei’s government and national soccer czar Claudio Tapia.
title: Argentine Police Raid Football Federation Offices in Corruption Probe

author: Kati Pohjanpalo
description: Peace is closer for Ukraine now than at any time since the start of Russia’s full-scale invasion in early 2022, Finnish President Alexander Stubb said.
title: Finland’s Stubb Says ‘Quite Close’ to Peace Deal in Ukraine

author: Nayla Razzouk
description: A French lawmaker plans to propose a bill to parliament early next year to bring back a pesticide banned in France since 2018, but still allowed in the wider European Union.
title: French Lawmaker Proposes Pesticide Bill as Farmers Ready Protest

author: Okech Francis
description: South Sudan said it was still pumping oil to facilities in neighboring Sudan crucial to its crude exports, even after rebels captured the production hub on Monday.
title: South Sudan Says Oil Still Flowing to Facility Seized by Rebels

author: Petra Sorge
description: Germany plans to tweak the system that controls the local assets of Rosneft PJSC to ensure it is complying with the tougher US sanctions imposed on the Russian oil company last month.
title: Germany to Tweak Local Rosneft Trusteeship to Avert US Sanctions

author: Bob Van Voris
description: A federal judge in New York ruled that the Department of Justice can release grand jury materials from the criminal prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.
title: Judge Says DOJ Can Release Ghislaine Maxwell Grand Jury Material

description: President Donald Trump shifts US policy and will let Nvidia sell powerful H200 chips to China. But regulators for Xi Jinping may not be fully on board. Bloomberg's Ed Ludlow reports.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Shifts Stance in Letting Nvidia Sell H200 Chips to China

author: Jonathan Gilbert
description: President Javier Milei’s government reduced tariffs on exports of soybeans, corn and wheat as he seeks to make good on a repeated promise to do away with the levies, which have held back Argentina’s farmers for years.
title: Milei Cuts Export Taxes on Argentine Soy, Corn and Wheat

author: Marilen Martin, William Wilkes
description: Germany’s machinery industry is headed for its longest production downturn in over three decades, exposing the broader vulnerabilities weighing on Europe’s biggest economy.
title: German Machinery Slump Drags On in Blow to Merz’s Turnaround Bid

author: Swati Gupta
description: India’s main opposition leader reiterated allegations of widespread electoral fraud in a speech in parliament Tuesday, listing out systemic changes in order to allegedly pilfer votes in recent state and national elections — charges that the government has been denying.
title: Indian Opposition Leader Doubles Down on Electoral Fraud Claims

author: Peter Martin
description: The streets of Tanzania’s biggest city, Dar es Salaam, were deserted on Tuesday as residents heeded government orders to remain indoors to avoid arrest, a sign the state’s bloody crackdown may have deterred protesters.
title: Brutal Crackdown Keeps Tanzanians Away From Planned Protests

author: Fola Akinnibi
description: Warren, Raskin cite ‘serious concerns about conflicts of interest within DHS and DOD’ that they say could erode public confidence.
title: Democrats Want Probe of Trump Officials and Immigration Deals

author: Daniel Basteiro
description: Spain plans to maintain 2025’s level of net debt issuance next year, according to Economy Minister Carlos Cuerpo.
title: Spain Targets €55 Billion in Net Debt Issuance in 2026

author: Milda Seputyte
description: Thousands gathered in Lithuania’s capital to protest legislation they say will raise political pressure on public media and align the Baltic nation with eastern European countries that have tightened controls on free speech.
title: Outrage Over Proposed Media Law Draws Thousands in Lithuania

author: Brendan Murray
description: President Donald Trump said he might consider lowering tariffs on some US goods while reiterating that his broad use of import taxes is helping lure investment and revive long-suffering industries like auto and semiconductor manufacturing.
title: Trump Defends Tariff Impact While Allowing He Might Cut ‘Some’

author: Julian Lee
description: The amount of Moscow’s crude on tankers has risen by 28% since the end of August
title: Russia's Oil Tanker Logjam Crushes Prices Even as Exports Surge

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: The Swiss government rejected a report that a retroactive reduction of US tariffs on Switzerland has already been agreed with Washington.
title: Swiss Government Rejects Report on Retroactive US Tariff Cuts

author: Mario Parker
description: President Donald Trump said that Russia is in a stronger military position in its war with Ukraine and chided European leaders for what he characterized as excessive dialog with scant results.
title: Trump Says Russia in Stronger Position on Ukraine, Chides Europe

author: Laura Davison
description: President Donald Trump indicated he would judge a new Federal Reserve chair by whether they immediately move to cut interest rates.
title: Trump Says Rate Cut Will Be Litmus Test For New Fed Chair

author: Daniel Hornak
description: Slovakia’s government pushed through an overhaul of whistleblower protection, prompting the European Union’s executive body to raise concerns about the move’s compliance with EU law.
title: Whistleblower Office Overhaul in Slovakia Sparks EU Concern

author: Eddie Spence
description: Indonesia will slap hefty fines on miners that have illegally operated beyond their forest permits, the latest move by President Prabowo Subianto as he cracks down on the sector.
title: Indonesia to Levy Large Fines on Miners Breaching Forest Permits

author: Andras Gergely
description: President Donald Trump denied offering Hungary a financial lifeline in case of a run on the forint, according to an interview with Politico published Tuesday.
title: Trump Denies Offering Orban a US Financial Shield for Forint

author: Kasia Klimasinska
description: President Donald Trump warned that Nicolás Maduro’s “days are numbered” as the president of Venezuela, amid speculation the US may carry out land strikes on that country.
title: Trump Warns Maduro’s ‘Days Are Numbered,’ Politico Reports

author: Maciej Martewicz
description: The European Commission will on Tuesday approve Poland’s plan to provide state aid for its first nuclear power plant, Prime Minister Donald Tusk said.
title: Polish Aid for Nuclear Power Plant Set to Get EU Nod, Tusk Says

author: Sanne Wass
description: Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen’s approval rating slumped to the lowest point of her current term, as the fallout from November’s municipal vote defeat weighs on her government ahead of national elections due next year.
title: Danish Premier’s Support Hits Lowest in Years as Election Nears

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz said elements of a new US national security strategy unveiled last week are unacceptable to Europe and advised President Donald Trump to avoid going it alone.
title: Merz Says Parts of US Security Strategy Unacceptable for Europe

author: Isolde MacDonogh
description: European defense stocks are rallying as Germany prepares to greenlight more defense spending, and Morgan Stanley analysts say there are bigger gains ahead.
title: Europe’s Defense Rally Is Just Beginning, Says Morgan Stanley

author: Colum Murphy
description: Donald Trump’s decision to allow Nvidia Corp. to sell advanced chips to China marks more than just a shift in US tech policy. It also raises questions about how far he’ll go to steady ties with Xi Jinping.
title: Trump’s Nvidia Shift Hands Xi Opening on National Security Curbs

author: Philip Heijmans
description: The roots of long-simmering tensions between the Southeast Asian neighbors stretch back to colonial-era maps.
title: Trump’s Thailand-Cambodia Peace Accord Fractures

author: Samuel Stolton
description: The European Union won’t be cowed by US attacks on how it polices Silicon Valley firms, the bloc’s competition chief Teresa Ribera warned.
title: EU Won’t Be Cowed by Musk and Trump Attacks, Ribera Warns

author: S'thembile Cele, Ntando Thukwana
description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa urged his party to improve policy execution as it looks to reclaim voter trust following the historic loss of its parliamentary majority last year.
title: South African President Urges ANC to Act on Policy as Vote Looms

author: Jennifer Creery
description: British American Tobacco Plc is seeing early benefits from a US crackdown on illicit vaping products, though it stopped short of upgrading its guidance due to uncertainty around the timeline of enforcement efforts.
title: BAT Says US Crackdown on Illegal Vapes Critical to Sales Growth

author: Courtney Subramanian, Jarrell Dillard
description: President Donald Trump is headed to the Poconos for the first foray in a domestic travel push designed to address persistent voter frustration over inflation and affordability concerns.
title: Trump Resumes Domestic Travel Hoping to Calm Affordability Worry

author: Katarina Hoije
description: Military juntas in three West African states warned they would shoot down any aircraft that violated their airspace, after a Nigerian military plane made an emergency landing in Burkina Faso.
title: West African Juntas Issue Threat After Nigeria Emergency Landing

description:
Bloomberg Daybreak Europe is your essential morning viewing to stay ahead. Live from London, we set the agenda for your day, catching you up with overnight markets news from the US and Asia. And we'll tell you what matters for investors in Europe, giving you insight before trading begins.

On today's show, Nvidia shares gained after President Donald Trump granted the company permission to ship its H200 AI chips to China in exchange for a 25% surcharge. President Trump's son-in-law Jared Kushner emerges as a player in Paramount's fight for Warner Bros. Discovery, days after Netflix agreed to a deal. And Bloomberg is told European leaders are optimistic they will reach a deal to use frozen Russian assets to fund Ukraine's reconstruction.

Today's guests: Tatjana Greil Castro, Co-Head of Public Markets at Muzinich, and Sonali de Rycker, Partner at Accel. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Nvidia Gains As Trump's Approves AI Chip Sales To China | Daybreak Europe 12/09/2025

author: Heidi Taksdal Skjeseth
description: A news conference planned for Tuesday by Nobel Peace Prize Laureate María Corina Machado in Oslo was postponed.
title: Nobel Winner Machado’s Briefing Delayed as Oslo Arrival Unclear

author: Randy Thanthong-Knight
description: Thai Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul is using fresh border skirmishes with Cambodia to tap nationalist sentiment at home before an election. In doing so he’s gambling it won’t unduly irritate US President Donald Trump, who claimed credit for ending a previous outbreak of fighting.
title: Thai Premier’s Hard Line on Cambodia Fighting Risks Irking Trump

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: South Korea deployed military aircraft after seven Russian warplanes and two Chinese aircraft entered an air identification zone maintained by Seoul, escalating tensions in a region already strained by an ongoing diplomatic rift between Beijing and Tokyo.
title: South Korea Scrambles Jets as Chinese, Russia Warplanes Approach

author: Milda Seputyte
description: The Lithuanian government has declared a state of emergency over weather balloons that continue to drift over the border from Belarus, creating risks for civil aviation.
title: Lithuania Declares State of Emergency Over Balloons from Belarus

author: Michal Kubala
description: Czech billionaire Andrej Babis made his political comeback as prime minister with pledges to make good on promises to reverse years of austerity.
title: Billionaire Babis Returns to Czech Premiership to Nix Austerity

description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy and his allies made progress on using frozen Russian sovereign assets to back a €90 billion ($105 billion) loan for Ukraine’s reconstruction, UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s office said following talks in London on Monday. European leaders are increasingly confident they will reach a deal to use the immobilized Russian assets before the end of the year. Bloomberg’s Oliver Crook reports.
title: Europe Nears Deal to Use Frozen Russian Assets

author: Michael Nienaber
description: German lawmakers are set to approve 29 military procurement contracts worth a record €52 billion ($61 billion) next week, part of the government’s push to transform the Bundeswehr armed forces into Europe’s strongest conventional army.
title: German Lawmakers to Approve Record €52 Billion in Defense Orders

author: Alessandra Migliaccio
description: The European Central Bank once again asked Italy to rethink declaring its gold reserves the property of its people, a move critics say could open the door to the government selling off bullion.
title: ECB Renews Request for Italy to Reconsider Gold Reserves Plan

author: William Horobin, Ania Nussbaum
description: French Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu faces a key vote on the social security budget on Tuesday that risks fueling political turbulence and uncertainty over how the country will plug holes in its public finances.
title: France’s Budget Process Teeters on Social Security Bill Vote

author: Tom Rees
description: The soaring cost of schooling children with conditions including autism and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder has driven borrowing by local authorities to record levels amid warnings that many councils are heading for insolvency.
title: Special Needs Lift UK Local Authority Borrowing to Record Levels

author: Randy Thanthong-Knight, Suttinee Yuvejwattana
description: Thai and Cambodian troops exchanged artillery fire overnight, with Bangkok accusing its neighbor of firing rockets into civilian areas as the long-simmering border dispute flared into its most serious violence in months.
title: Shelling Kills Cambodians, Struck Thai Homes in Escalating Border Clash

author: Ruth Carson
description: The Federal Reserve may have to turn to quantitative easing to lower long-term borrowing costs if bond markets start to question the independence of the next chairman, according to Man Group.
title: Fed May Need QE If Market Questions New Chair, Man Group Says

author: Ditas B Lopez
description: The Philippines has frozen the assets of two lawmakers allegedly tied to a widening graft scandal, President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said, adding to thousands of bank accounts and hundreds of other assets already immobilized as the state moves to recover public money.
title: Philippines Freezes Two Lawmakers’ Assets as Graft Probe Widens

description: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Gigi Sohn, Consumer Advocate in Broadcast Marketplace, discusses Netflix's & Paramount's bids for Warner Bros., and if either deal will benefit the consumer. Senator Jerry Moran (R-Kansas) shares his initial reaction to hearing President Trump allowing Nvidia to export H200 chips to China. Former US Ambassador to NATO, Julianne Smith, talks the latest on Ukraine & Russia. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump to Let Nvidia Export H200 Chips to China | Balance of Power: Late Edition 12/08/2025

author: Augusta Saraiva
description: Sao Paulo Governor Tarcísio de Freitas announced he supports Flavio Bolsonaro’s decision to run for president of Brazil next year, even as investors still hope he’ll emerge as the right-wing candidate.
title: Market-Darling Freitas Backs Flavio Bolsonaro’s Presidential Run

author: Jimmy Jenkins
description: A dozen FBI agents sued the Trump administration over their firing in September for having taken a knee during a 2020 demonstration in Washington following the police killing of George Floyd.
title: FBI Agents Who Kneeled at Floyd Protest Sue for Wrongful Firing

author: Alastair Gale
description: As relations with China continue to deteriorate, Japan is embarking on its biggest military buildup in at least four decades.
title: Japan Builds Up ‘Missile Archipelago’ Near Taiwan to Counter China

author: Irina Anghel
description: Black Friday discounts failed to prevent a slowdown in UK retail sales as the Labour government’s budget damaged consumer confidence, according to a report by the British Retail Consortium.
title: UK Retail Sales Growth Cools as Budget Fears Offset Black Friday
